name: forex_pair_compact_10q
title: 10 Comprehensive Forex Pair Questions (Binary Choice)
description: Condensed, comprehensive FX pair assessment. Each question forces a binary choice between the two currencies.

variables.name: texts
variables.description: Recent headlines, summaries, transcripts, and reports relevant to both currencies.

questions.text: Considering central bank statements, policy meeting outcomes, and interest rate trajectory - which currency's monetary policy stance is more hawkish/supportive of currency strength?
Looking at interest rate expectations, forward guidance, and market pricing of future rate moves - which currency has a more favorable rate outlook?
Evaluating the gap between current policy rates, real interest rates (adjusted for inflation), and central bank forward guidance - which currency offers better yield positioning?
Analyzing GDP growth, employment data, manufacturing/services PMI, and consumer spending - which currency's underlying economy shows stronger momentum?
Examining inflation trends, wage growth, and proximity to inflation targets - which currency shows better price stability and inflation control?
Reviewing trade balance, business confidence, and resilience indicators - which currency's economy demonstrates better fundamental health?
Assessing political stability, election risks, geopolitical tensions, and credit ratings - which currency operates in a lower-risk environment?
Considering banking system health, fiscal sustainability, debt levels, and structural concerns - which currency faces fewer systemic risks?
Evaluating foreign capital flows, safe-haven demand, institutional positioning, and ETF/asset flows - which currency is attracting stronger investor demand?
Reviewing analyst forecasts, strategist recommendations, sentiment surveys, and positioning - which currency has more bullish market consensus?
